questions.question: Which two factors does risk typically depend on?
options: Adverse impacts and likelihood of occurrence

questions.question: What distinguishes an insider attack from an outsider attack?
options: Insider attacks are always passive, outsider attacks are always active
Insider attacks originate inside the security perimeter, outsider attacks originate outside
Insider attacks target confidentiality, outsider attacks target availability
questions.answer: Insider attacks originate inside the security perimeter, outsider attacks originate outside

questions.question: What is the primary function of a security policy?
options: To provide technical specifications for firewalls
To document all past security breaches
To define criteria for security services and constrain system activities
To allocate budget for security purchases
questions.answer: To define criteria for security services and constrain system activities

questions.question: Which of these is an example of a system resource or asset?
options: Major applications, physical plants, and personnel
questions.answer: Major applications, physical plants, and personnel

questions.question: What is the relationship between threats and attacks?
options: Threats are theoretical concepts, attacks are always successful
Threats are the potential for harm, attacks are the execution of threats
Threats only come from humans, attacks can be automated
Threats target hardware, attacks target software
questions.answer: Threats are the potential for harm, attacks are the execution of threats

questions.question: Which organization is a nongovernmental organization that publishes International Standards?
